sentence.Network_en: They stopped in their tracks and stared at him in amazement.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们突然停下，惊讶地盯着他。

sentence.Network_en: I was expressing some amazement and wonder at her good fortune.
sentence.Network_cn: 我对她的好运既惊奇又感叹。

sentence.Network_en: When we drove through the gates, she wore a look of amazement.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们驶过大门时，她流露出惊讶的神情。

entry.def: Amazement is the feeling you have when something surprises you very much.

example.ex: I stared at her in amazement.

means.word_mean: 1. the feeling that accompanies something extremely surprising;

auth_sentence.content: Noticing my amazement at it all, the elderly lady seated opposite me stoops across the table.
auth_sentence.res_content: Noticing my amazement at it all, the elderly lady seated opposite me stoops across the table.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Noticing my amazement at it all, the elderly lady seated opposite me stoops across the table.

auth_sentence.content: There was no anxiety or even amazement in their voices, just a kind of war-room self-satisfaction.
auth_sentence.res_content: There was no anxiety or even amazement in their voices, just a kind of war-room self-satisfaction.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was no anxiety or even amazement in their voices, just a kind of war-room self-satisfaction.

auth_sentence.content: The first thought was--relief: relief and amazement, and a sudden, sharp, quite surprising affinity.
auth_sentence.res_content: The first thought was--relief: relief and amazement, and a sudden, sharp, quite surprising affinity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The first thought was--relief: relief and amazement, and a sudden, sharp, quite surprising affinity.

sentences.en: Imagine my amazement when a 70-year-old man beat me at tennis.
sentences.cn: 在网球赛中, 我竟被一位70高龄的老人击败, 请想像一下我当时的惊愕状态。
